org.openadaptor.util
Class PropsUtils

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.util.PropsUtils
public class PropsUtils
extends java.lang.Object

Helper methods for use with Java properties files

Author:
Russ Fennell

PropsUtils

Method Detail

getIntFromProps

public static int getIntFromProps(java.util.Properties props,
                                  java.lang.String name,
                                  int defaultValue)
Trys to convert the property defined by the name into an int

Parameters:
props - the Java Properties object
name - the property name
defaultValue - the default value to use if the property is not defined
Returns:
the integer value of the property or the default value
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if the property value cannot be converted into an int

getFloatFromProps

public static float getFloatFromProps(java.util.Properties props,
                                      java.lang.String name,
                                      float defaultValue)
Trys to convert the property defined by the name into a float

Parameters:
props - the Java Properties object
name - the property name
defaultValue - the default value to use if the property is not defined
Returns:
the float value of the property or the default value
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if the property value cannot be converted into a float

getBooleanFromProps

public static boolean getBooleanFromProps(java.util.Properties props,
                                          java.lang.String name,
                                          boolean defaultValue)
Trys to convert the property defined by the name into a boolean

Parameters:
props - the Java Properties object
name - the property name
defaultValue - the default value to use if the property is not defined
Returns:
true if the property value is not null and is equal, ignoring case, to the string "true" or the default value if the property doesn't exist

getArrayListFromProps

public static java.util.ArrayList getArrayListFromProps(java.util.Properties props,
                                                        java.lang.String name)
Returns a list of the properties defined by the name and with a zero based index appended to the name. Will return all properties until the next one in the list does not exist. Therefore you cannot retrieve non-contiguous sets of properties.

Parameters:
props - the Java Properties object
name - the property name
Returns:
list of property values according to the rules above
